alert.note: Alert for Bourbon; Cherokee; Crawford (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Freeze Warning issued October 18 at 3:01AM CDT until October 18 at 10:00AM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...FREEZE WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM CDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Sub-freezing temperatures in the lower to middle 20s will occur across the area early this morning. Areas east of Springfield could drop into the upper teens. * WHERE...Portions of southeast Kansas and central, east central, south central, southwest and west central Missouri. * WHEN...Until 10 AM CDT this morning. * IMPACTS...Frost and freeze conditions will kill crops, other sensitive vegetation and possibly damage unprotected outdoor plumbing. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Temperatures will drop into the lower 20s and upper teens again tonight into Wednesday morning.
info.instruction: Take steps now to protect tender plants from the cold. To prevent freezing and possible bursting of outdoor water pipes they should be wrapped, drained, or allowed to drip slowly. Those that have in-ground sprinkler systems should drain them and cover above- ground pipes to protect them from freezing.
